program.title: The Piercing Blazing Bell Amidst Intertwined Swirls of Musical Shoal Water The Painting Drowned In Its Own Sound
can i forget the rising sun
...those stones, watching, over lochs, through time…
Before Entrance and After Exits, Dreams Await
Luo Jiang Yuan – A bit blue
it is within you that the ghosts acquire voices

concerts.title: First Voices
concerts.description: A program featuring works by Jerod Impichchaachaaha’ Tate, inti figgis-vizueta, Elizabeth Ogonek, Michael Begay, and Gabriela Ortiz, performed by enSRQ musicians.

concerts.title: enSRQ + SCD
concerts.description: Collaboration between ensembleNEWSRQ and Sarasota Contemporary Dance. Program details not specified in source.

concerts.title: Crumb
concerts.description: A tribute to George Crumb (1929-2022), featuring his Madrigals and Black Angels, and Margaret Brouwer's Demeter Prelude.

program.title: Black Angels: Thirteen Images from the Dark Land (1970)
movements: Threnody I: Night of the Electric Insects Sounds of Bones and Flutes
Threnody III: Night of the Electric Insects

concerts.title: Vespers for a New Dark Age
concerts.description: Collaboration with Verdigris Ensemble, featuring Christopher Cerrone's The Branch Will Not Break and Missy Mazzoli's Vespers for a New Dark Age.
sponsors: Sarasota County Tourist Development Cultural/Arts Grant

program.title: The Branch Will Not Break (2015)
movements: I. Lying in a Hammock at William Duffy’s
II. Two Horses Playing in the Orchard
IV. From a Bus Window in Central Ohio, Just Before a Thunder Shower
V. Having Lost My Sons, I Confront the Wreckage of the Moon: Christmas, 1960
VI. Two Hangovers, Number Two: I Try to Waken and Greet the World Once Again

program.title: Vespers for a New Dark Age (2014)

concerts.title: And the Hits Keep Coming
concerts.description: A celebration of percussion, featuring works by Emma O’Halloran, Krists Auznieks, Shaun Tilburg (commission/world premiere), and Mark-Anthony Turnage (co-commission).
A double bill of contemporary classics: HK Gruber’s Frankenstein! and Louis Andriessen’s De Staat, performed by the largest ensemble in enSRQ history.

concerts.title: Don't Look Down
concerts.subtitle: (featuring Conor Hanick)
concerts.description: Yaz Lancaster's Sequoia opens our season with ethereal, reflective sounds that remind us of the importance and intimacy of being together in the concert hall. Conor Hanick returns with the second ever performance of Chris Cerrone's poignant work, Don't Look Down, for percussion quartet and piano, named one of The New York Times' Best Pieces of 2020. Two years in the making, Max Grafe's Shadow Theater, composed specifically for George, Samantha and Conor, will finally receive its premiere.

program.title: Shadow Theater for violin, piano and percussion (2020)
Don't Look Down for prepared piano and percussion quartet (2020)

concerts.title: void
concerts.description: A co-commission from Atlanta's ensemble vim and enSRQ, New Renaissance Artist Elizabeth A. Baker's evening length work, void, combines the power of visual projection, electronic processing and acoustic performance in an experience that should not be missed. This is an intrepid, dual work, consisting of modular performances for each individual ensemble which then receives a unique performance for both groups, together.
sponsors: Sarasota County Tourist Development Tax revenues

program.title: void for violin, cello, percussion, electronics and projections (2021)

concerts.title: enSRQ + Chroma Trio
concerts.description: enSRQ's second commission of 21/22 is a team effort with Boston-based Chroma Trio, which shares founding member Samantha Bennett, bringing to life a new work by Tyson J. Davis, String Trio. Art-inspired works for strings flesh out this collaboration, including a duo from enSRQ favorite, Andreia Pinto Correia, Du Yun's string quartet, I Am My Own Achilles Heel and Freya Waley-Cohen's trio, Conjure.

program.title: Tres Quadros de Viera Da Silva/Fragmentos Multiplos (2009)
I Am My Own Achilles Heel (2019)

concerts.title: Vortex Temporum
concerts.subtitle: (featuring Han Chen)
concerts.description: Our journey into the French spectral compositional movement comes full circle with this presentation of Gérard Grisey's Vortex Temporum, featuring Van Cliburn Semi-Finalist and frequent enSRQ pianist, Han Chen. Witness the completion of the arc drawn from last season's works (Grisey's Stele, Périodes and Philippe Hurel's Loops II) with Hurel's musical reflection on Grisey's towering presence throughout 20th century composition, Tombeau in Memoriam Gérard Grisey and a return of enSRQ friend, Nina C. Young's, À bout de souffle for solo piano.

program.title: À bout de souffle for piano scordatura (2016)

concerts.title: Waves
concerts.description: To cap off the return of live audiences and end our 6th season, enSRQ premieres a final co-commission, WAVES, by Sebastian Currier. Based on the eponymous book by Virginia Woolf, this work for soprano, small ensemble and electronics, enters the thoughts of various women and girls, from a young child to an eighty year old woman, ultimately representing just one woman's conscious life, not unfolding over decades, but coexisting within a single day. WAVES is paired with Anna Thorvaldsdottir's Entropic Arrows and firn, the second work of our season exploration of Yaz Lancaster's music.

concerts.title: It's About Time
concerts.description: We return to our roots in our season-opener presenting a program of solo and duo works by a diverse field of composers performed by Co-Artistic Directors Samantha Bennett, violin and George Nickson, percussion.

concerts.title: Solitude and Suffrage
concerts.description: This program for clarinet, strings, mezzo-soprano, and piano celebrates the historic event of womens' suffrage in the United States and a time to reflect on the solitude that the COVID-19 quarantine era has caused for many across the world.

concerts.title: Enter the Vortex
concerts.description: Two of the twentieth century's most enigmatic masters come together for Phillipe Hurel's virtuosic tribute and Gerard Grisey's seminal evening length work in this program that has been rescheduled from our 2019-2020 season.

concerts.title: Nightfall!
concerts.description: Rescheduled from the 2019-2020 season, we celebrate the diversity of style and duality of current American acoustic music. With two new commissions, we're hardwired for creating masterpieces of the modern age.

concerts.title: Sun Colors
concerts.description: SUN COLORS celebrates the warmth and diversity of contemporary string writing, with music of Reena Esmail, Michael Djupstrom, Jessica Meyer, and Tan Dun. Building up in instrumentation from one solo violin, to duo, trio and finally full quartet, the works on this program take inspiration from poetry, folk song and the sun's ever unifying and life-giving presence. Don't miss our last virtual concert of the season!

program.title: I Only Speak of the Sun

concerts.title: Frequent Flyers
concerts.description: Winds and Brass take flight from the lone voice of Berio's Trumpet Sequenza, to the full complement of orchestral brass in Magnus Lindberg's Ottoni and Peteris Vasks' Music for Fleeting Birds. Pianist Conor Hanick shines in technicolor with Messiaen's Colors of the Celestial City, an ode to the stars in this fanfare of a Season Opener.

program.title: Sequenza X for solo C trumpet and piano resonance

concerts.title: Peculiar Dreams
concerts.description: enSRQ launches into orbit in Peculiar Dreams, with two works pushing with stratosphere of sonic capabilities: St. Pete local Elizabeth A. Baker's atmospheric Cosmic Dreams and Andrew Norman's An Index of Peculiar Strokes. Penderecki's iconic Sextet brings the program earthbound again to end with two feet firmly planted on the ground.

concerts.title: Peculiar Dreams
concerts.description: enSRQ launches into orbit in Peculiar Dreams, with two works pushing with stratosphere of sonic capabilities: St. Pete local Elizabeth A. Baker's atmospheric Cosmic Dreams and Andrew Norman's An Index of Peculiar Strokes. Penderecki's iconic Sextet brings the program earthbound again to end with two feet firmly planted on the ground.

concerts.title: Fire & Light
concerts.description: Sparks fly in Fire and Light, featuring composer and violist Jessica Meyer in three of her deeply human works: Delta Sunrise, Tapped into the same vein, and Sagrada Familia. Conor Hanick and Samantha Bennett perform Eric Wubbels' epic and searching 'the children of fire come looking for fire' to set this concert ablaze.

program.title: "the children of fire come looking for fire"

concerts.title: Enter the Vortex
concerts.description: It's past versus future as we Enter the Vortex with two of the twentieth-century's most enigmatic masters. 2017 Van Cliburn Semi-Finalist Han Chen joins enSRQ and Co-Artistic Director George Nickson for Philippe Hurel's virtuosic tribute, Tombeau to Gerard Grisey, an apropos preamble to our presentation of Grisey's seminal evening length work, Vortex Temporum.

concerts.title: Digital Trees
concerts.description: Digital Trees celebrates the diversity of style and duality of current American acoustic music with Marc Mellits' minimalist Splinter, Ken Ueno's intricate Pharmakon and Patrick Harlan's Digital. We're hardwired for creating masterpieces of the modern age with two new commissions. American trailblazer Max Grafe composes a new trio to showcase principal artists Samantha Bennett, George Nickson and Conor Hanick. enSRQ is also proud to join a consortium with Royal Birmingham Conservatoire, Music Academy of the West, and The Eastman School of Music to commission and perform the Florida Premiere of David Maric's Mallet Quartet.

concerts.title: enSRQ + HUB New Music
concerts.description: Great Groups Think Alike! enSRQ welcomes friends from Boston, HUB New Music, for an exciting collaboration to open the 2018-19 season. Pairing minimalist masters with adventurers in texture and darkness.

concerts.title: Metal, Wind, & Wood
concerts.description: Metal of the vibraphone, wind of the oboe, and wood of the strings. Italian master Franco Donatoni shines in two important works. Features oboist Nicholas Arbolino continuing the Berio Sequenzas cycle.

concerts.title: Holographic
concerts.subtitle: Collaboration with New Music New College featuring Daniel Wohl, composer and pianist and Daniel Schwarz, visual artist
concerts.description: enSRQ teams up with New Music New College. This evening length work for live visual projections and electroacoustic ensemble explores different worlds of improbable combinations of sounds, hidden sonic landscapes both acoustic and electronic.

concerts.title: Railroad 150
concerts.description: 2019 marks the 150th Anniversary of the completion of the Transcontinental Railroad at Promontory Point, Utah. An inventive, deep and profound look at how trains, railroads, and humans have charted paths; both constructive and destructive.

concerts.title: Orpheus and His Lyre
concerts.description: A literal and figurative look at the myth of Orpheus, a story that has allured artists throughout the centuries. Features Katherine Siochi on harp and Matthew Aucoin performing and presenting his work. Thea Lobo solos with Samantha Bennett.

concerts.title: Working Notes
concerts.description: enSRQ's second commission receives its World Premiere - a percussion concerto from renowned Portuguese composer Andreia Pinto Correia, inspired by sketchbooks of Joan Miro. Features Brad Williams reprising his iconic performance in Berio's Trombone Sequenza.

concerts.title: Lost Landscapes
concerts.description: Journey from the New Mexico desert to the snowy north, to Tanglewood and New York City in this concert inspired by the spaces of nature around us.

concerts.title: The Space Around You
concerts.description: Part of Ringling International Arts Festival. A macro view of our surroundings, interacting with James Turrell's Joseph's Coat, mirroring the atmosphere and changing light of the sky.

concerts.title: The Magical World of Berio's Sequenzas
concerts.description: Part of Ringling International Arts Festival. A micro view focusing intensely on individual performers as virtuoso soloists, weaving through deeply personal human and musical expression.

concerts.title: Lou Harrison at 100
concerts.description: A centennial homage to Lou Harrison, celebrated American composer and maverick of sound. Featuring acclaimed pianist Sarah Cahill and Artistic Director Samantha Bennett.

concerts.title: Deep Red
concerts.description: Luciano Berio's Sequenzas cycle kicks off with Sequenza VIII for violin. Features composer Bright Sheng conducting his dreamscape marimba concerto.

concerts.title: Voice/Hammer
concerts.description: Two of Europe's most influential 20th Century masters. Features Sarasota's own mezzo-soprano Thea Lobo in Berio's Sequenza III.

concerts.title: Larger Forces
concerts.description: Season finale featuring enSRQ's first commissioned work and chamber orchestra works inspired by dance rhythms. Features oboist Adam de Sorgo.

concerts.title: Locals
concerts.subtitle: Sarasota composers. Sarasota musicians. Sarasota themed works.
concerts.description: A concert featuring Sarasota composers, musicians, and themed works.

concerts.title: Gardens, Clouds, Streams
concerts.subtitle: Evocative works by female composers.
concerts.description: A concert of evocative works by female composers.

program.title: all streams reach the sea at last

concerts.title: Glass
concerts.description: An intimate performance in the gallery space among glass artwork by Kathleen Mulcahy and Ron Desmett, part of Sarasota's Art Glass Weekend.

program.title: Reflections on the Nature of Water

concerts.title: Glass
concerts.description: Second performance of the Glass concert, an intimate performance in the gallery space among glass artwork.

program.title: Reflections on the Nature of Water

concerts.title: The Music of David T. Little
concerts.description: A collaboration with The Hermitage Artist Retreat featuring resident composer David T. Little, who will be in attendance to offer perspective on his inspiration.

program.title: and the sky was still there

concerts.title: New York Notes
concerts.description: The finale of our Inaugural Season! A powerful display of contemporary chamber music featuring New York's most exciting musical minds sharing the stage with Sarasota's stars.
